name: Hotel Solamar - a Kimpton Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked a last minute stay at the Solamar for our anniversary on a Monday night. The hotel was well decorated and was just as we expected. They sent a bottle of champagne up for our special night and we enjoyed the pool, wine, and coffee in the morning. We stayed on the pool level and it was really quiet on the weekdays. I would recommend the hotel to anyone, though we did park down the street to avoid the expensive valet parking.
reviews.title: Great Stay
Great location, fun vibe
reviews.text: Booked a three night stay from Sunday to Wednesday in July 2008. Overall, it was a good stay.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Location can't be beat. It's within three blocks of the Convention Centre, the orange line of the trolley system, and Petco Park. The major restaurants of Gaslamp are within 2 blocks. It's also only a $10 taxi ride from the airport and about a $10 ride to the zoo.
reviews.title: Nice hotel, excellent location

likes.disliked: — Room air-conditioning could have been better

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Staff at front desk were friendly and helpful. Bell desk was hit and miss as they were rushing to get to the people using valet parking. A major perk was that they enabled me to store my bags there for one extra day beyond my stay. I couldn't get the hotel for one extra night because of Comic Con so I stayed with a friend in Sorrento. I left my bags at the Solamar and picked them up the next afternoon before going to the airport.
reviews.title: Great base in San Diego

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: I requested a room away from the pool and found that this was already the case. My room preference of two double beds was accommodated also. My only criticism of the 10th floor room was that it was quite noisy due to the hotel's ventilation fan. Maintenance said that all 10th floor rooms were noisier due to the ventilation fan. I found it a bit distracting when we were relaxing in our room but it wasn't distracting enough to disturb sleep.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled on business
reviews.text: I enjoyed my stay here at Hotel Solamar. It is a stylish, well-appointed hotel, with a personal boutique feel. There is a nice lounge where they provide free coffee/tea service in the morning, and wine receptions in the early evening. There is also a hip small bar and pool area on the 4th floor deck (although not active currently in the winter).
reviews.title: Modern, stylish base for downtown SD experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled solo
reviews.text: The rooms are somewhat small but decorated nicely, with clean, stylish bathrooms and a very comfortable bed with their trademark super-silky Frette linens. My location was quiet initially, but during the summer it might have been noisy since it faced the pool area. Also there were some noisy partiers we could hear thru the wall another night, but they seemed to quiet down after we alerted the front desk.
reviews.title: Stay was really just OK

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled solo
reviews.text: The location can't be beat; slightly off the main drag in the Gaslamp Quarter, at the edge of the East Village. As a result it is less hectic, but still only a block to the main action. A CVS is a block away which is convenient.
reviews.title: Wonderful location and service in downtown San Diego

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled on business
reviews.text: There is a nice restaurant in the hotel also; my spouse wanted a late-night coffee and despite running a busy dinner service, the hostess went and got a complementary coffee for him! That is service.
reviews.title: I love staying here!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled on business
reviews.text: Parking, as expected for this area, is expensive valet only (around $36/night) but there are also some parking lots/garages nearby. There are large, convention size hotels all over downtown SD, but this one has style and character and feels more personal, without sacrificing any conveniences. The hotel rate we got was very reasonable too, probably because it is the off-season. A great place to stay in downtown SD.
reviews.title: Outstanding SanDiego Choice, Kimpton Service in an Excellent Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This lovely hotel is destroyed by the most bizarre pool scene I have ever come across in all my years of travelling. Im in my early 30's and my girlfriend in her late twenties and we found it way too much. At the weekend they bring in a local DJ from about 11am who plays unbelievably loud dance music right throughout the day, you cannot hear yourself think nevermind talking. The pool has hardly any beds but at the weekend when it fills up with obnoxious drunk people that the DJ brings with him you cant get a spot in the pool nevermind a sun lounger. They also rent out the cabanas so you may arrive down at 9 in the morning to be greeted with reserved signs on all the beds which sit their idle for most of the day because even when the beautiful people who booked them arrive they only want to be seen drinking in the pool. The pool area itself can be rented out to businesses and during one night of our stay was completely shut off to guests. If your a party animal you will of course love this vibe at the weekends but this is certainly not the place you want to go to at the weekends if you have children or just want to relax. One other thing about this hotel is the car parking, between tipping the valet and the car park fee be prepared to pay at least $40 a day.
reviews.title: Nice hotel, ridiculous pool scene

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled on business
reviews.text: This hotel definitely has the potential to be a wonderful place to stay. Unfortunately there are so many problems with the property that I cannot imagine staying here again. We arrived on a very early flight and had asked for an early check in which ended up being no problem. We were in town for a wedding and told by the groom that a gift bag had been delivered to our room but to our dismay there was no gift bag in our room or at the front desk. The Concierge said they couldn't find it and suggested that it was accidentally given to someone else in another wedding party. Then he offered their gift bag to us! Obviously we declined as that is not exactly the appropriate resolution to the problem.
reviews.title: If You Love To Party This is the Place for You

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Valet and Concierge services very slow and rather detached. If you enjoy good service with a finer touch you will not find it here. I found the previous reviews describing the service as catering to the 20 - something crowd (meaning they cater to the party/drunk crowds) to be very accurate. Lines were very long at the front desk for people either checking in or asking questions. Lines to get your car were even worse. Attempts to call down to the valet to have the car ready went unanswered several times. Room service was disappointing at best. We called most nights for a late snack and they either never answered the phone or said they would call back and never did. The front desk also called our room several times by mistake sometimes in the early morning or very late at night.
reviews.title: Kimptons are different but great

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The biggest problem at this hotel is the constant pool party. I cannot stress enough to people booking this hotel to book a room that doesn't overlook the pool and bar on the 4th floor. If you want a hotel to relax by the pool then this is not the hotel for you. The few chairs they have are taken first thing in the morning and the place is crawling with people in their 20s and 30s and DRUNK. By the end of the afternoon the pool area was littered with plates of half eaten food, beer bottles, dirty towels and other garbage these people left. The DJ started at noon and went until 11:30 or 12 at night. The music was a constant "thump thump thump" of house/techno mixed in with the noise of bar and pool patrons singing at the top of their lungs. Think of it as a nightclub right in the middle of the property. The drunk partygoers would then spill into the lobby every now and then and harass hotel guests. For a hotel that charges almost $250 per night (and $32 for parking per night) I was appalled that they were ok with all this. Several other guests we spoke to in the lobby were also very disappointed and angry. We demanded a room on the other side of the building to get away from the pool. Our new room was a little quieter but I began to realize that we were smack dab in the midst of more partygoers later that night who had rooms near ours. The noise from their rooms drifted down that halls and into our room. We called security about 4 times to complain about the yelling and screaming which finally ceased around 1am.
reviews.title: A great place to stay with your dogs in San Diego

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: I would not recommend this hotel to anyone who doesn't sit well with the younger crowd, partygoers and noise because that is what this hotel is all about. I fully intend on contacting this hotel and the manager about my experience here.
reviews.title: Not for sun bathers
Good hotel made better by its staff
reviews.text: Stayed in room #931 for three nights. King bed overlooking pool/bar area. Room was ample size for two people - oddly there is no dresser, just a closet. Bed was comfy. Flat screen TV, but no HD and no HBO. Bathroom was pretty good, tho no natural light. Plenty of natural light from street side. Bar/pool is hoppin' on weekend nights. I worried about the noise, but used the room's fan and my own white noise machine and had no troubles - light sleepers will want to be aware of bar noise. The staff is helpful, with exception of valets. When I arrived in a taxi, valet removed my bags from taxi but made no offer to bring inside. Weird and kinda rude. Neighborhood is full of bars/restaurants/drunk hipsters, not much shopping. It's a pretty easy walk to the water, trolley & Nordstrom. The Broken Yolk is one block away and a nice place for breakfast. Front desk staff great, even let me check in early, which is so nice after a cross-country flight. No in-room coffee (boo) but free coffee in the lobby each morning. Overall a good hotel made better by its staff.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Hotel Solamar for 7 days in mid January. It was a great stay. The hotel is in a great location, within walking distance of 5th Avenue, the harbor, the mall and other attractions. The staff was excellent, especially Hosea at the front desk. The valets were helpful and hospitable; the housekeeping was excellent when we asked for their help. The rooms are not huge but for a large city a very nice size. We loved the 4th floor lounge with firepits and cabanas. We did not eat there but enjoyed the 5-6pm wine tastings each day in the beautiful hospitality room.
reviews.title: Excellent

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled solo
reviews.text: I would recommend this hotel and I really am astounded at the price we paid. We loved our San Diego trip and hope to return there and to Hotel Solamar soon.
reviews.title: Room was too small; No in-room coffee; Parking was too expensive.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: P.S. The drive to Pascadena and winning the college BCS National Championship was a great extra for this University of Alabama fan!
reviews.title: Beautiful hotel, great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: The hotel's parking policy is exploitive : $35 (plus tips) per day for valet parking; no self-parking allowed. Similarly, bottled water in the room was $5.50. There was no coffee-maker in the room, so each morning you have to dress and go down to the lobby to get your cup of coffee. The room was so small there was no space for a dresser. Indeed, there were no drawers at all. I had to live out of my suitcase for 5 days. The location was convenient, but not worth all the annoyance. Never, never again would I stay at the Solamor.
reviews.title: Good but not great

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall, the Hotel Solamar was pretty good. We got a REALLY good deal on a travel site, but I wouldn't have paid full price for it. I would recommend it to someone only if they received a similar deal because it definitely wasn't worth what they charge per night without the discount. I travel several times a year, and have stayed in many luxury hotels, and while Hotel Solamar was nice, it was not at all what I expect from a luxury hotel. The location was absolutely perfect though, but next time I travel to San Diego, I probably wouldn't stay there again unless I got another REALLY good deal. If you want people to be impressed that you are staying at a crazy expensive hotel, stay here. If you want real luxury, go somewhere else.
reviews.title: Pretty good but not truly luxurious

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Pros: Beautiful and modern decor; friendly and helpful staff; great location, right in Gaslamp; very pet-friendly; free coffee in morning and wine in evening; beautiful pool on terrace
reviews.title: New Years At Solamar

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled on business
reviews.text: Cons: temperature control was impossible, room was either burning up or freezing; water pressure was out of control, nearly ripped my skin off; bed extremely noisy, I couldn't roll over at night without waking my husband up for all the squeaking; no coffee pot in room; while staff was friendly and helpful, they weren't always correct in their advice (one sent us to a trolley stop way out of the way, another told us the wrong bus to take, and another sent us to a restaurant that she said was exactly what we described when it actually was the opposite of what we described); our room overlooked the pool, which was beautiful, but crazy loud on the weekends
reviews.title: Pleasant stay close to convention center and gaslamp district

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What a great hotel! Great accomodations, great location right in the heart of the Gaslamp District. Without a doubt the most helpful and friendly staff I have ever encountered at a hotel. From the front desk, to the bartenders, to the valet - all of them were extremely friendly and just NICE! Which is a nice change compared to what you get sometimes at other hotels. The hotel has a great outdoor lounge/pool on the 4th floor and another nice restaurant/bar on the lobby floor. Rooms are nice size, 42 in flatscreens, very comfortable beds. Very modern and chic hotel. I can't say enough good things and i just hope to go back soon.
reviews.title: Great Stay Overall

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: Received an excellent rate from my conference and was very happy with my choice. I could walk to the convention center in less than 5 minutes and then was right next to the gas lamp district for meals and entertainment.
reviews.title: comfortable stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just had a most EXCELLENT stay at the Solamar!!!
reviews.title: Oh ,what a night!!!
Didn't know it was a "dog" hotel !
reviews.text: We live in San Diego and like to stay in different parts of the city for special nights.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled with friends
reviews.text: This was my birthday and we couldn't have picked a nicer place!
reviews.title: Nothing short of exceptional!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We checked in early at about 12:30 and not only was our room ready , but we were upgraded to a Master Suite on the pool level. I knew that the pool bar can get noisy but since it was a weekday I accepted the new room and BOY was I happy!!
reviews.title: Fabulous Boutique Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It was just gorgeous!
reviews.title: I proposed, she said yes...I think the sweet room helped!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled on business
reviews.text: My mom and I stayed in this hotel for 5 nights in August 2008. Overall, I am really satisfied with this hotel. It is worthy of the 4-star title. The decor, both in the lobby and in the rooms, was artistic and tasteful, and the service at the front desk was excellent. They also offered free coffee/tea in the morning and free wine tasting in the afternoon, everyday. Though I was not able to take advantage of the wine tasting, by the number of people who did everyday, I gathered the wine couldn't be too bad.
reviews.title: Lovely botique hotel

likes.disliked: — Room a bit small, bathroom sink too shallow

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My only complains are: (1) the room was just a bit too small, so only one soft chair was provided -- I would have preferred two, so both my mom and I could sit comfortably. (2) The newly-renovated bathroom had a really shallow sink. While it is stylish, it is really not very practical.
reviews.title: Hotel Solamar is outstanding in very way!

likes.liked: — the service, staff, location, friendliness, decor, bath products, view of the baseball stadium
likes.disliked: — can't really think of anything other than no vending machines but the Hyatt that we stayed at on the fiirst nights of our trip did not have vending machines either

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: Oh, also, the valet parking was expensive -- $32 a day! But I took the advice of other trip-advisor reviewers, and parked in a nearby covered parking lot for $8/day.
reviews.title: The Hotel Solamar and Meeting San Diego

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Complementary wired high-speed Internet is really nice!
reviews.title: Cool Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled on business
reviews.text: If I visit San Diego again, I would definitely consider staying there again.
reviews.title: Hotel Solamar - trendy hotel in San Diego

likes.disliked: — Very small gym, too expensive breakfast

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Hotel Solarmar is a lovely boutique hotel with great aesthetics & very clean. We stayed for 6 nights, in early June and the location was perfect! We are pretty independent tourists, I had planned most of our activities before we arrived; but Timin, their Concierge, was great by pointing out the various places throughout the Gaslamp District to be sure to check out during our stay. And he gave us a real variety, not just several places all doing the same thing.
reviews.title: Location, location, location!

likes.disliked: — too little time spent at hotel with all of our adventures

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you plan on visiting La Jolla, we cannot recommend ENOUGH, "LaJolla Kayak" (with the blue awnings, on the 2 opposite corners of Ave. de la Playa). The staff will seriously go out of their way for you. Most of their Guides have lived their whole lives in La Jolla, & they care a lot about the area, so they make the tours educational and great! Kevin & I cannot thank Mike and Dre enough for everything. If you go anywhere else, you just might be crazy... :)
reviews.title: Good Trip

likes.disliked: — smallish closets for an extended stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Favorite bike & kayak tours: La Jolla Kayak, for sure!!
reviews.title: Great boutique hotel, great location!

likes.liked: — Very young/hip/trendy vibe! And walking distance to a lot of restaurants, bars, and shops.
likes.disliked: — They allow pets so the hallways kind of smell like pet deodorant spray. Although our room was spotless and very clean.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Favorite restaurant: Panevino
reviews.title: Great location, great accomodations

likes.disliked: — Price for parking on hotel premises

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled on business
reviews.text: Favorite breakfast: Cafe 222
reviews.title: Nice Hotel, Great Restaurant

likes.liked: — The room decor and the restaurant

description: At the apex of cosmopolitan downtown San Diego, the boutique Hotel Solamar lounges between the exciting Gaslamp Quarter, trendy East Village and stunning San Diego Convention Center. These vibrant neighborhoods complement the luxury hotel’s coastal cool décor and personable service. Home to the sassy rooftop LOUNGEsix and adjacent Jsix restaurant, Hotel Solamar is also moments from PETCO Ballpark, San Diego Bay, Balboa Park and the San Diego Zoo and miles of beaches.
